Stable release: Latest stable software release/Auslogics Disk Defrag

Supported platforms: Windows XP and later,Windows Server 2003 and later
Auto defrag when idle: Yes, with Windows Task SchedulerWindows Task Scheduler "Idle" schedules and options settings will be applied to scheduled tasks.

Scheduler: Yes, with Windows Task SchedulerDefraggler's GUI only provides an interface to configure defragmenting activity in Windows Task Scheduler.
YesCondusiv Technologies claims its InvisiTasking technology eliminates the need for scheduled defragmentation.

Supported file systems: FAT16, FAT32, NTFS. Does not work at all on ExFAT
CLI: Partial MyDefrag CLI -- Can execute script via CLI but displays disk map.
Script: Yes !! MyDefrag Scripts -- Runs exclusively via scripts. Included scripts good enough for most. The open-source predecessor JkDefrag does not have this level of power user script support. Geek-freak custom ultra-optimizing scripts are what distinguishes this defragmenter from the rest.
Scheduler: Partial,NotinGUI. MyDefrag Scheduler -- Can only add, running specific built-in scripts via installer. Everything else, including all edits and deletes, must be set up manually in Windows task scheduler.

Supported file systems: FAT16, FAT32, exFAT, NTFS, ReFS* and CSVFS
Supported platforms: Windows XP SP3 or higher (x86, x64),Windows 10, Windows Server 2003 SP1,Windows Server 2019

Developer: Dmitri Arkhangelski, Justin Dearing, Sayem Chaklader, Stefan Pendl
Script: YesUltraDefrag can be run in batch scripts and apply several parameters separately for each disk.UltraDefrag documentation and UltraDefrag 5.0.4 handbook
Stable release: Latest stable software release/UltraDefrag, Open source version discontinuedSourceForge comment citation
